title: The Count of Monte Cristo by Alexandre Dumas
description: Not the most quotable of books, but a fabulous indulgent read of human nature (at its worst).

title: Snow Crash by Neal Stephenson
description: A cyberpunk classic -- origin of the term 'metaverse'-- and such a fun meditation on a cyber society.

title: The Crytponomicon by Neal Stephenson
description: A real treat for historical fiction. A must-read for anyone interested in cryptography. Stephenson outdoes himself on this one.

title: War and Peace by Leo Tolstoy
description: A classic that is worth the time investment.

title: The Great Gatsby by F. Scott Fitzgerald
description: A fabulous intoxicating dream of a book -- have read it about 7 times.

title: Paul Graham's Essays
description: A collection of essays on startups, programming, and life. You may notice all my translations of his articles ...

title: Simon Willison's Blog
description: A blog about programming, data, and the web. Some real gems like the Perfect Commit.

title: The Hitchhiker's Guide to the Galaxy by Douglas Adams
description: A hilarious and thought-provoking book about the universe.

title: The Matrix
description: Haven't checked out the sequels, but the first one is a staple for the memes alone.

title: The Catcher in the Rye by J.D. Salinger
description: Hilarious. A treat of a book that was impossible to put down.

title: The Social Network
description: A movie about the founding of Facebook that explores themes of ambition and betrayal.

title: The Godfather
description: A classic movie about the mafia that explores themes of power and family.

title: The Picture of an Artist as a Young Man by James Joyce
description: For those who like a story that is both intelligible and by Joyce.

title: The Imitation Game
description: Truly poignant -- couple it with the Cryptonomicon and just indulge in the world of cryptography.

title: 1Q84 by Haruki Murakami
description: A mind-bending journey; there is something so magical and surreal about Murakami's writing.

title: Kafka on the Shore by Haruki Murakami
description: A surreal and dream-like book that is a must-read for fans of Murakami. A shorter read than 1Q84 but just as impactful.

title: Never Let Me Go by Kazuo Ishiguro
description: A haunting and beautiful book that explores themes of love and **spoiler**. Genuinely moving.
